description: From French phorésie, from Ancient Greek φόρησις (phórēsis, “wearing, garment”), from φορέω (phoréō, “I wear, I bear”) +‎ -σις (-sis, nominal suffix).

entries.meaning: (zoology) An association between two organisms in which one (e.g. a mite) travels on the body of another, without being a parasite.
